paper.title: Affine stereo calibration
paper.venue: Computer Analysis of Images and Patterns
paper.abstract: Affine stereo calibration has been identified as the determination of the plane collineation induced by the plane at infinity. Generally, this so-called infinity homography can be determined provided 3 image correspondences of points at infinity. In this paper, we first show that affine stereo calibration for the case of two cameras with the same intrinsic parameters is possible with one less point at infinity. Then, we propose two practical methods for affine calibration in the general case. The experimental results on simulated and real images are presented.
